Recipe.title: Wonton Soup
Recipe.Source: From the Kitchen of Mitsuko Barnhardt, Di's Mom
Recipe.Description: When Di looks back and remembers peaceful times at home, she remembers her mom making Wonton Soup. When we were looking for a new recipe to create, Wonton Soup became a priority and we came up with this.

section.instruction: If desired, get the Wontons by using the Entrees / Stove Top: Wontons Recipe. (Use the Envelope Style folding.)
Slice the Carrots into very thing discs. Then lay the discs out flat and slice them into into strands.
In a large pot Place Oil and Garlic. Heat on high until Garlic begins to sizzle.
Carefully add Broth, Carrots and Ginger, then bring to a boil.
Add Green Onions and Bok Choy.
Carefully add Wontons, 1-by-1, then boil for 5 minutes.
Add Mushrooms and boil for 1 minute.

Notes.note: If you have leftovers, fish out the wontons and store them in a dry container, separate from the soup. (Otherwise they get all soggy.)

Modifications.modification:
Do NOT use Grated Ginger if Di is eating with you!
Di doesn't like Ginger, so her mom set it in a bowl on the table and it was used as a condiment.
You can create the Chicken Broth by using 10 Cups Water + 10 Chicken Bouillon Cubes (or the equivalent).
Many versions of this recipe include ¼ Cup Sliced Bamboo Shoots in the soup.
